channel.title: HTB
channel.generator: Webpage HTML Export plugin for Obsidian

item.title: Initial Recon and Access
item.description:
Initial Nmap scan showed three open ports, out of which FTP and SSH were fairly secure from first look. As usual, we start with enumerating the web app.


So, this being a easy machine, we are automatically logged in upon accessing the app. Moreover, upon going to the SecuritySnapshot functionality, we can observe numeric parameters in the URL..which suggests some sort of IDOR. And yep, first I thought the response will contain something sensitive..then since the files getting downloaded were PCAP files, I opened wireshark and started going through those. Voila..got the user creds for Nathan.


I was able to log in using SSH as Nathan.


I think for the first time, I have gotten a solid hit with Linpeas.


It was a very simple exploit in the end to obtain root, and conversely the flag.
